definition: drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

sentences.english: The fugitives could not have taken this as an encouraging sign.
sentences.chinese: 這些逃亡者並沒有被看作是鼓舞士氣的事件。

sentences.english: They cannot experience the joy and inspiration of life.
sentences.chinese: 他們體會不到生活的快樂和鼓舞。
我們爲我們的勝利而歡欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: The order of commendation from the general headquarters lifted up still higher the morale of the troops.
sentences.chinese: 總司令部的嘉獎令大大地鼓舞了那個部隊的士氣。

sentences.english: The perfect flower to lift spirits or to simply bring joy to someone's day.
sentences.chinese: 完美的花鼓舞精神或乾脆帶來歡樂的人的一天。

sentences.english: Already the youngest university in the world’s top 100, HKUST’s feat will give heart to other relatively recent foundations around the world.
sentences.chinese: 它的排名鼓舞了世界上其他相對年輕的大學。

sentences.english: Sample an enormous amount of creative work and you’ll produce an inspirational concoction.
sentences.chinese: 體驗大量創新的作品，你會熬出鼓舞人心的藥汁。

sentences.english: Only a surging Kansas City Royals team buoyed my spirits.
sentences.chinese: 只有剛出道不久的堪薩斯皇家棒球隊能鼓舞我的精神。

sentences.english: Encourage their children to learn to make progress, to foster a positive attitude towards life of children.
sentences.chinese: 鼓舞孩子好學上進，培育孩子積極的生活態度。

sentences.english: Theoretical analysis and simulation results show the validity of RGA.
sentences.chinese: 理論分析和仿真實驗結果都是令人鼓舞的。

sentences.english: Motivation Forces that energize, direct, and sustain a person's efforts.
sentences.chinese: 鼓舞，指引和維持個人努力行爲的驅動力。

sentences.english: This is business journalism animated by the spirit of the Duracell bunny.
sentences.chinese: 這是一本受到金霸王電池兔精神鼓舞的商業雜誌。

sentences.english: On the other hand welcome to the new job companion and the encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面臨於新來的工作火伴暗示歡送和鼓舞。

sentences.english: Aldrin sees his role now as reactivating that spirit.
sentences.chinese: 重新鼓舞起人們的這種精神，就是奧爾德林現的任務。

sentences.english: Zhao’s works are inspirational and convey a strong sense of Asian philosophy and aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 趙的作品甚能鼓舞人心，表達濃厚的亞洲哲學及美學。

sentences.english: The President's words cheered the family.
sentences.chinese: 總統的話鼓舞了那家人。

definition: to stir oneself up/to raise one's spirits/to inspire
to move and appeal/to rally to a cause/to impel/to inspire
to spur on/to urge on/to encourage sb (e.g. to make progress)
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
